head.citation-title: BioInfo@UAVR at eRisk 2020: On the use of psycholinguistics features and machine learning for the classification and quantification of mental diseases
head.abstracts: Copyright © 2020 for this paper by its authors.This paper describes the participation of the Bioinformatics group of the Institute of Electronics and Engineering Informatics of University of Aveiro in the shared tasks of CLEF eRisk 20201. The eRisk initiative fosters Natural Language Processing research for the automatic detection of risk situations on the internet. Similar to the previous years, the challenge was organized in two tasks, which aimed the early detection of self-harm (T1) and severity of depression (T2) in online forums. We addressed these tasks both from a standard machine learning perspective and from a behavioural point of view. The results we obtained endorse the use of social monitoring as a possible complement to more traditional public health surveillance and intervention practices.
